title: Hotdog-Sandwich Unification Framework

prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups (sandwich purists, hotdog traditionalists, culinary professionals, linguistic scholars, public representatives)
steps.outcome: Create a legitimate, authoritative body to define taxonomic standards and resolve classification disputes
risks: Difficulty achieving consensus among entrenched ideological groups
Lack of enforcement mechanisms for Commission rulings

prerequisites: Commission defines structural, cultural, and functional criteria for hotdog-sandwich taxonomy
Commission establishes process for product evaluation and classification
steps.outcome: Recognize hotdogs as a distinct food category that shares some sandwich-like properties
risks: Dissatisfaction from purists on both sides unwilling to compromise
Confusion over new classification system among consumers and businesses

steps.action: Implement Dual Labeling and Flexible Menus
prerequisites: Commission establishes guidelines for dual labeling of hotdog and sandwich products
Restaurants and food service providers update menus and signage
steps.outcome: Allow consumers to choose how to categorize and order hotdog-sandwich hybrid products
risks: Increased complexity and cost for food service providers
Potential for continued debate over 'true' classification

prerequisites: Commission develops educational materials explaining new hotdog-sandwich taxonomy
Coordinate with media, schools, and community organizations for outreach
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the hybrid hotdog-sandwich classification

prerequisites: Commission defines clear processes for filing and adjudicating classification disputes
Gain agreement from stakeholders to abide by Commission rulings
steps.outcome: Provide legitimate channels for resolving ongoing disagreements over hotdog-sandwich taxonomy
risks: Difficulty enforcing Commission decisions if stakeholders refuse to comply
Potential for disputes to escalate into broader food classification conflicts

resource_requirements: Funding for Hotdog-Sandwich Taxonomy Commission operations
Expertise in food science, culinary history, linguistics, and conflict resolution
Cooperation and buy-in from key stakeholder groups
Media and public outreach campaign resources
